headline: Supermicro Expands Its Portfolio of Cloud Service Provider Solutions with New 6U 20-Node MicroBlade® Powered by AMD's EPYC™ 4005 Series Processors
summary: Supermicro, Inc. (NASDAQ: SMCI), a Total IT Solution Provider for AI, Cloud, Storage, and 5G/Edge, is announcing the latest addition to the AMD based EPYC™ 4005 series CPU Servers, optimized to deliver powerful performance, efficiency, and affordability. Supermicro will feature the new MicroBlade multi-node solution, ideal for companies looking for a scalable and cost-effective solution with centralized management for power, cooling, and networking.

headline: Did Supermicro’s (SMCI) Data Center Expansion and AI Partnerships Just Shift Its Investment Narrative?
summary: In the past week, Super Micro Computer, Inc. reiterated its fiscal 2026 revenue guidance of at least US$33 billion and highlighted robust demand for its liquid-cooled AI server solutions, while launching its new Data Center Building Block Solutions business line and progressing towards a strategic partnership with Hitachi Vantara. This combination of new product offerings, enterprise partnerships, and strong revenue commitments showcases Supermicro's expanding role as a comprehensive...

headline: Super Micro, IBM, quantum computing stocks: Trending Tickers
summary: Market Catalysts host Julie Hyman tracks several of the day's top trending stock tickers, including Super Micro Computer's (SMCI) pre-reported a miss on revenue estimates ahead of its first quarter earnings release, IBM (IBM) shares sliding lower after software sales disappointed Wall Street expectations, and quantum computing stocks are taking off after the Wall Street Journal reported that the Trump administration is considering equity stakes in the space.  To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

headline: Super Micro stock falls on prelim. Q1 sales miss: What to know
summary: Super Micro Computer (SMCI) stock is under pressure after the chipmaker released preliminary first quarter net sales of $5 billion, falling short of analyst estimates of $6.5 billion. Yahoo Finance anchor Julie Hyman outlines the latest. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

headline: Super Micro Computer stumbles on Q1 revenue shortfall
summary: Investing.com -- Super Micro Computer (NASDAQ:SMCI) stock fell as much as 10% Thursday morning after the company reported preliminary first quarter revenue below its previous guidance, citing design win upgrades that pushed expected revenue to the next quarter.

raw.headline: Super Micro Computer stumbles on Q1 revenue shortfall
raw.summary: Investing.com -- Super Micro Computer (NASDAQ:SMCI) stock fell as much as 10% Thursday morning after the company reported preliminary first quarter revenue below its previous guidance, citing design win upgrades that pushed expected revenue to the next quarter.

headline: Super Micro cuts first-quarter revenue forecast on delivery delays
summary: The AI server maker said it now expects first-quarter revenue for fiscal year 2026 to be $5 billion, compared with its earlier forecast of between $6 billion and $7 billion.  Super Micro, however, reiterated its fiscal year 2026 revenue forecast of at least $33 billion, driven by what it described as "robust demand" for its AI solutions.

headline: Supermicro Provides First Quarter of Fiscal Year 2026 Business Update
summary: SAN JOSE, Calif., October 23, 2025--Super Micro Computer, Inc. (Nasdaq: SMCI), a Total IT Solution Provider for AI, Cloud, Storage, and 5G/Edge, today is providing a business update for the first quarter of fiscal year 2026 (Q1'26), ended September 30, 2025, and schedules earnings call for November 4th at 5pm EST.
